result.execSummary:
The defendant Al R Mcclain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Court authorizes transfer to Milwaukee County or a jail most convenient to defendant's employment or residence.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.  All monies due shall be paid at $50 per month commencing 10/1/2022 (one payment for attorney fees and costs due); if payments not made timely, judgment shall be entered.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Al R Mcclain appeared in court. Defendant has not obtained counsel, does not have funds to hire an attorney at this time. Court appoints Atty Robert Bucket.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate to be determined.
